titleStmt.title: William Munday et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9293

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: The undersigned citizens of Clark County Kentucky, respectfully represent to your Excellency that John Rankins confessed a Judgment for $2000 and costs in an indictment, at the May Term 1860, for gaming, in which game Geo Gossey, Wm T White and James White participated, and which occurred 3 years prior to the indictment, We would respectfully beg of your Excellency to remit his fine with his associates Goosey. And the Whites, They are all young men of great cleverness poor, but highly respectable, We would not ask the interposition of Executive clemency, if we did not think they deserved it and the public good not injured thereby.

William Munday
James Munday
O. P. Evans
A N Bush
Thos Gaines
Geo M Jackson
S. W. Brock
David Brown
W. W. Storm
S H Cochran
John P Hukill
